metadata.title: Tailwind Styling and Layout Foundation
metadata.description: Introduce Tailwind CSS in the Vite runtime, apply baseline styling to existing UI elements, and establish a responsive page layout shell for the review workflow.

majorTasks.title: Install and configure Tailwind in the runtime pipeline
majorTasks.description: Add Tailwind/PostCSS dependencies and runtime configuration so utility classes compile in both dev and production builds.

subtasks.title: Add Tailwind and PostCSS dependencies
subtasks.description: Install Tailwind CSS, PostCSS, and Autoprefixer in the existing npm toolchain.

subtasks.title: Create Tailwind configuration and stylesheet entry
subtasks.description: Create Tailwind/PostCSS config and wire a base stylesheet into the runtime entrypoint.

verification.description: Vite dev/build pipelines compile Tailwind utilities without CSS configuration errors.

testRequirements.description: Validate Tailwind runtime wiring across local and CI workflows.

requiredScenarios.description: Developer runs the Vite dev server after dependency installation.
requiredScenarios.expectedOutcome: App boots with Tailwind base styles loaded and no runtime CSS import errors.

requiredScenarios.description: Tailwind directives are missing or misconfigured.
requiredScenarios.expectedOutcome: Build output fails with clear CSS pipeline diagnostics instead of silent style loss.

requiredScenarios.description: TypeScript build and Vite build run back-to-back after Tailwind setup.
requiredScenarios.expectedOutcome: Both commands pass with no config conflicts or module-resolution regressions.

majorTasks.title: Apply baseline utility styling to review UI components
majorTasks.description: Style the existing review page controls, summary, lists, and detail panels with a consistent Tailwind utility baseline.

subtasks.title: Style top-level shell and control panel
subtasks.description: Add baseline spacing, typography, and control styles to App/ReviewRunPage and schema upload controls.

subtasks.title: Style result, issue, and readable detail views
subtasks.description: Apply consistent table/list/card treatments across summary, file results, issue tables, and readable sections.

gotchas.text: Visual changes must not remove existing labels/roles used by integration tests and accessibility queries.

verification.description: Baseline UI styling is visible across empty/ready/running/complete/error states with readable contrast.

testRequirements.description: Ensure styling updates preserve interaction behavior and semantic structure.

requiredScenarios.description: User uploads valid schema and FRD files through styled controls.
requiredScenarios.expectedOutcome: All prior interaction flows succeed and styled elements remain keyboard-accessible.

requiredScenarios.description: Schema upload fails and error view is shown.
requiredScenarios.expectedOutcome: Error panel styling appears without hiding or breaking actionable controls.

requiredScenarios.description: Duplicate filename rows render in styled result lists.
requiredScenarios.expectedOutcome: Rows remain distinct and selectable with stable semantics.

majorTasks.title: Create a responsive page layout shell
majorTasks.description: Introduce a basic responsive layout that organizes controls, run summary, file list, and detail panel for desktop and mobile.

subtasks.title: Define layout structure and breakpoints
subtasks.description: Add grid/flex layout utilities and section wrappers so content adapts cleanly between narrow and wide screens.

subtasks.title: Align detail panel placement with file-list navigation
subtasks.description: Ensure detail panel placement remains predictable and readable when switching between files or tabs.

verification.description: Layout remains usable on mobile and desktop widths without overlap or clipped controls.

testRequirements.description: Validate responsive-layout structural behavior does not regress UI flow.

requiredScenarios.description: Run completes with mixed results and detail panel is opened.
requiredScenarios.expectedOutcome: Summary/list/detail regions all remain visible and navigable in layout shell.

requiredScenarios.description: Run issues are shown with no file rows.
requiredScenarios.expectedOutcome: Run-issue panel placement remains stable and does not collapse surrounding layout.

requiredScenarios.description: Schema replacement occurs after file selection.
requiredScenarios.expectedOutcome: Layout resets to baseline state without orphaned spacing or stale sections.
